text: Elias Abbas (born 1 December 2001) is a Swedish singer who participated in Melodifestivalen 2018 with the song "Mitt Paradis". In 2017, he released his debut single "Min Queen". In February 2019, he released a new single along with Anis Don Demina. Abbas also released the single "Problems", featuring Noad, in 2019. His first single of 2020 was "Big Time", featuring Stress and K27. ==Discography== ===As lead artist=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" colspan="1"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font- size:85%;"| SWE |- ! scope="row"| "Mitt Paradis" | 2018 | 66 | rowspan="3" |- ! scope="row"| "Problems" | 2019 | 51 |- ! scope="row"| "Big Time" | 2020 | — |} ===As featured artist=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" colspan="1"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font- size:85%;"| SWE |- ! scope="row"| "Utanför" | 2019 | 43 | |} ==Notes== ==References== == External links == Category:Living people Category:2001 births Category:Swedish male singers Category:People from Stockholm
